file_content.text: A few years with those vorantiki running free, and the ecosystem will start to balance out again.
My field sensors are reporting vorantiki returning to their territories. You did it!
They can't thank you for this, so I will. I found this during my botanical cataloging; I hope you can use it.
We can't let innocent animals be turned into those cyber-monstrosities--please, you have to set those vorantiki free.
Just look at this world. So much variety. There's creatures here that couldn't evolve in any other biosphere.
And what do the Gormak do? They take these beautiful animals, like the vorantikus, and turn them into cybernetic monsters! It's horrific!
That sounds incredibly inhumane, not to mention painful.
Does it hurt the animals?
I don't know, but I doubt they enjoy it.
Forcing animals to be their war machines... this will be a dark chapter in Gormak history.
The Gormak demean themselves.
Who cares about the Gormak? It's the vorantiki that matter, and the planet.
Those Gormak are a little too creative when it comes to weaponry.
Living war machines.
And the poor vorantiki aren't the only ones being harmed.
It's like the Gormak decided they just weren't scary enough as they are.
And terrifying.
I'll have you know that, aside from the occasional blood frenzy, vorantiki are lovely creatures.
What's a "vorantikus"?
"Vorantikus"?
A fascinating apex predator with distinctive dorsal--er, those large, bluish, carnivorous animals.
Even without the Gormak implanting them, they could still bite you in half.
They're all monsters anyway.
No, no! Well, maybe, but the vorantiki's natural aggression is being heightened by these tech implants.
Making them into... cyber-beasts is destroying predator-prey dynamics and breeding cycles; Voss's ecology is suffering.
But, if we could free the animals before they're implanted, the Gormak will waste months trying to capture more. The vorantiki go free, the Gormak are distracted--everyone wins!
Maybe I can help you get these creatures back to the wild.
I like this plan.
Wonderful! I'd appreciate anything you can do.
Won't these beasts attack me?
No, it's fine, the Gormak keep them docile for implantation. The vorantiki should ignore you--just don't smell too tasty.
I'll show you where to find the vorantikus pens, but be careful, there'll be plenty of Gormak nearby. You can't help the animals if you get hurt.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
But it's for the good of... forget I asked.
Those cyber-beasts are a blight on Voss.
